Titles: Terrible customer service- DO NOT use this site
Details:
I made duplicate booking on Super.com for the same day by mistake. I did not complete transaction for my first attempted booking, thinking I made a mistake in my biling address. When I tried to return to the earlier web page to correct the billing address, the site jumped to new booking page where I completed my booking, and received one text confirmation. But when I clicked on the link to check my booking, I found duplicate booking with 2 identical charges.

Finding a customer service phone number on the site was impossible. I Looked throught the site and found a section "duplicate booking" stating "we understnad non-refundable bookings can be tricky. If that's the case, reach out to us, and we'll wok our magic to contact the hotel … see if they can authorize a refund. Please note that the hotel has the final say on granting the refund. "

However, no where in the site provide a phone number. Then I found the chat service and texted with Vince, who asked for my email and the booking number, then texted me that there is nothing he can do. Vince did not "work: his "magic". When I tried to initiate another chat service, the chat site blocked further chat.

I contacted Mariott to explain the situation, to see if Mariott can grant the refund. Per Mariott, since I booked with 3rd party who collected my payment, Mariott has no authority to grant the refund. I believe Mariott is right.

In my previous booking experience with Priceline, Expedia, Hotel.com etc, all the booking mistakes are handled directly by these 3rd party services wtihout difficulty. The way Super operates is fraudulent in my opinion.

Titles: Overbooked, bad communication and ZERO support!
Details:
DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE! I booked a 2-night stay for a work conference on 26-27 November. The hotel called me on 16 November and informed me that there was an issue with my booking and I did not have a room. I contacted Super.com 3 times before I received a reply from their Help Desk - THE DAY BEFORE I WAS DUE TO ARRIVE AT THE CONFERENCE! They said everything was fine with my booking, and my room was confirmed. I called the hotel again to double-check, and there was nothing under the confirmation number Super.com provided, nor was there a booking under my name. The hotel manager sent me her conversation with Expedia - a Super.com supplier, I believe - to ask them to stop overselling the rooms as they were at full capacity. I have sent another 3 emails to their "Help" Desk since, and still no refund or reply.

If you want security for your travel booking, don't use Super.com.

This review is not only for the Hampton by Hilton Usaquen but also Super.com and Hotelbeds. I will be posting this review under their names also.
I'm a US citizen. I travel to Colombia frequently. I recently stayed at Hampton by Hilton Usaquen Bogota. When I checked my credit card there was a $50 charge I didn't recognize. I expected additional charges because we charged meals to the room. I contacted them to ask what it was and they said it was VAT. It's a tax on Colombian citizens. My wife is Colombian but is a US resident and I showed them her green card. After arguing with them about the charge for over an hour they informed me that Hotelbeds actually charged me the VAT tax. They even sent me an invoice from Hotelbeds. I've never heard of Hotelbeds and there's no way to contact them. I booked with Super.com who apparently uses Hotelbeds as an agent. Now the whole time I'm chatting with the hotel I was also chatting with Super.com who kept insisting I contact the hotel and refused to help me. They never even mentioned Hotelbeds. Finally I got a call from Super.com and the representative had also never heard of Hotelbeds and continued to refuse a refund or help. I'm currently waiting for a super.com supervisor to contact me. But no one will take responsibility or offer a refund for an erroneous charge. I want my $50 dollars back! This review is a warning to travelers. If you use Super.com, or stay at a Hampton by Hilton you can expect to be screwed by Hotelbeds. Check your credit card, not the hotel bill or Super.com invoice because they won't show the VAT fee. Again, I have no problem with the room charge or other charges but I was taken advantage of because I'm an American with a Colombian wife. My advice is to avoid Super.com and Hampton by Hilton. I still have no idea who Hotelbeds is because you must be a business with an account with them to contact them.

I booked a reservation with Super, B_******* at The Restoration, with check-in on 03 Nov 2023. Due to a family emergency, I called to cancel my reservation a few days after the cancellation deadline but well before my check-in date, and was told they would grant me a one time exception if I completed their refund request form and obtained a note from the hotel agreeing to cancel the reservation at no cost. The hotel was happy to oblige and I submitted it along with their form on 10/25. As of 11/10, they have not responded to my emails or processed my refund. When I call, their feedback is they are trying to negotiate the refund with their travel partner, Expedia, but when I call Expedia, they say they are happy to process the refund, but the request has to come from Super, who will not provide any information about when or if they've contacted them. They claim to have expedited the request three separate times and always guarantee me I will hear back by the following day, but that never occurs. This site is a scam and I highly discourage customers from using it. They use other third party travel companies to make the bookings and do not have any affiliation or relationship with the hotels. They claim to not be able to call or email customers unless it's from a manager, and will not call hotels directly or accept calls from them (this was baffling to the hotel when I explained it). I will be filing a small claims case against them if they do not follow through with my refund. Customers beware!

We had driven 5 hours to get to a hotel we made a reservation through the fake super.com agency. When we get to our destination, the hotel (Red Inn Detroit-Farmington Hills) is not able to find our reservation. I called Super at 10:57pm EST and after being on hold for 30 minutes the agent said that the urgency team will call me asap to see what the issue is. The team calls me at 11:34 pm EST and say they will reach out to a travel partner and see what the issue is. No one knows how long it's going to take. We are all waiting in the car in the cold.
Someone calls me at 11:59 pm EST and provides me with a confirmation number, saying I could use this to check in at the hotel. We check with the front desk at the hotel and they say such confirmation number does not exist. They confirm once again that no reservation exists under my name. I had added my dad's name to the reservation as well, and there was no reservation under his name either. I call back Super and there are six people in the queue in front of me. I email them and they reach out saying we will work on this. It is now 12:23 AM EST, and my dad who is pretty old and fragile is feeling sick. We decided not to waste more of our time and health (we had waited for two hours already) and leave our destiny to this sham company so we made our way to the front desk to make our own reservation to book a room for the night. Such a Nightmare. Such a HORRIBLE experience.

Details:

We booked a hotel for Chicago for a music show. We made sure to purchase the insurance in case something happened (we all learned to love insurance after covid). Well, we got news that our event was canceled and tried to fill out the application to get a refund. We didn't get any communication so we looked online and to our surprise it was DENIED! We tried calling and were on hold for over an hour and were still like 98 in line. NEVER USE THIS COMPANY! I filed a dispute with my card to try and not be out the money since this company doesnt hold up their end of the bargain, even when you purchase the EXTRA INSURANCE!

I reserved a motel room for one night and had to cancel due to the flare-up of my wife's pre-existing medical condition (post-radiation therapy, gastrointestinal episodes that flare up painfully at times). Beforehand, per their policy I had paid extra for the right to obtain a refund. The process for obtaining the refund was through a third party, Refundable.me. It was a complicated, demeaning process. We provided them with medical records to show her schedule of treatments, but they wanted very invasive details and information that went back years. We gave up when they requested a document from our physician that stated his "medical recommendations regarding attending this booking." In other words, did the doctor authorize our stay in a motel?! Don't expect a refund, even if you pay for the right to get one.

Buyer beware. This company will not book you the room that you paid for. When you realize they screwed up on your reservation, good luck getting a response from their customer service team to help you correct their mistake. We were put in a very bad situation on our family vacation. Do not book a hotel room from Super.com unless you want stress and frustration!

I booked for 2 days at a hotel booked via super.com. I had to check-out early as I had some personal situation (some medical condition) for which we decided to check-out after 1 day (instead of 2 days). Before doing any action, I checked with Hotel and they confirmed that I can do that without any penalty or charge. I got a bill from Hotel showing me 1 day of stay.

Super never refunded my money. They first told be to share the invoice from the hotel to prove that I stayed for 1 day and they told to show medical certificate of my condition. This is quite unethical.
There is nowhere written in the cancellation policy that I have to provide these details. Moreover, when I talked to chat agent multiple times, they were not supportive at all.
Either Supers policy should clearly state that any change is not refundable, even if hotel says OK or Super should return the fund that customer is eligible, especially when Hotels are getting paid for the duration of stay and not the duration of booking.

I will never ever recommend such unethical platform, especially when the price comparison is not much and other available platform are more established and ethical.

To add to that they are providing coupons which are also tricky. You have utilize that within 2/3 weeks and who do you think will book another hotel within next 2/3 weeks. It is almost a prank played to the customer.

Titles: Ripped me off. Customer service refused to make it right.
Details: I tried to reserve a room for October 12 while standing out in front of the hotel with the hotel desk clerk. Before finalizing my reservation, the hotel employee told me that two other people within last couple hours had reserved a room via Super.com app and the app changed their reservation to a date further out. He said I should doublecheck my date is correct so I did with him watching. It was not correct so I changed it to the 12th with him watching me do it and after hitting the button to close the deal, the confirmation arrived and the date has reverted back to the incorrect date and hotel suggested I contact customer service chat to have them edit it to correct date. I did and they refused to correct it, even after I informed them that I would be normally be willing to book an additional room tonight and keep the incorrect booking for next week but I would not be in town for that date and couldn't possibly stay at this hotel on the date THEY changed my booking back to. Despite having the hotel desk clerk as an eye witness to my correct booking info, they refused to do anything at all. I informed them that I would contact my bank and dispute the charge on the incorrect booking and never use Super.com ever again and their response was "ok thanks for reaching out to us. Hope we helped you resolve your issue." The hotel employee said I was victim number three of this bait and switch tactic. Good luck with using this site. For a couple dollars more I got the room from another booking site and next week an empty room with my name on it will go to waste unless my bank refuses to pay out on their trickery. Saving two extra dollars on the rate cost me $75 loss. Nothing you can do other than dispute it with your own bank I guess. Not sure why they call that chat department "customer service" because they provided zero service. Done.

Reservación was made for Oct 28 though 29,2023, when we were ready to check to the hotel the reservation is not at the hotel recervacion system, the receptionist couldn't do anything they ask to call Super.com, I called super.com and the operator said they will call the hotel to resolve the situation, the didn't resolved anything, we ended up paying for the room ourselves, we will not recommend super.com ti anyone they will leave you stranded.

When we go to the hotel we could check in till 4 pm, it was 12:45 am, so I purchased another room after manager said I could get a refund from super.com. Details: I reserved a hotel with this "service". When I checked in they didn't have my name on record, despite being charged by Super.com. The hotel staff said this was becoming common. When I called super.com for support, they said the hotel I hadn't had a booking at needed to "submit a letter proving I didn't have a booking to their website". When I asked what kind of proof would show that I had no booking, they said "a letter". I asked where on the website to submit it and they said "on the website". I asked for emailed instructions and they said they "couldn't do this". They are relying on inconvenience to profit off a service they can't provide.

Titles: Super.com yeah SUPER DUDS take your $ but don't deliver!
Details: I was forced to book and pay in full a month prior to trip I arrived to La Quinta by Wyndam in Hazelwood MO sounds fancy, there were homeless drug dealers hanging around at 130am June 3rd the front desk person was wearing club attire look like Monique in movie Precious! Very unprofessional, there was coffee spilled in elevator, the room was trash spilled white lotion dried in carpet, dirty comforters, stains on sheets and towels they supplied weren't fit to dry my car very old cheesy used towels! I checked out as soon as my brother could come get me the Mgr promised to refund me but SUPER.COM big dummies made it a cat & mouse game...once I arrived back in L.A. I contacted super dud.com they continously gave me the run around I will be contacting their corporate do not use these LOSERS THE ABSOLUTE WORST CUSTOMER SVCE!

Titles: Couldn't talk with a CSR to fix a mistake in my booking!
Details: I made a mistake in booking a last-minute room at a Holiday Inn Express in Miramar, FL when it should have been Miramar, CA. I communicated with Ericka who told me that policy would not allow a correction from the Florida hotel to California. I also called the Florida Holiday Inn Express to advise them I would not be checking in since I was in California. Ms.Fatima kindly explained that because it was a 3rd party booking, only Super.com could change/cancel. I then contacted IHG to ask assistance & they texted that it was on Super.com. Finally, I contacted my credit card company to dispute the charge.

I was very disappointed with this booking website. I admit that in their terms and conditions it clearly states that there are no refunds or amendments, but I was already staying at the hotel and was just renewing my stay for another day through their website, and when I clicked on the wrong date and chose the same day, I booked two rooms on the same night, one of which I had already stayed in.
I was stranded at the airport because of an issue with my eight year old daughter's passport, so that cascaded down to the entire rest of the trip, and I clicked on the wrong date in my upset state, communicated for three hours, and it still turned out that I wasn't allowed to change the date. The hotel was willing to cooperate, I was willing to add money, super.com disagreed, what stopped you from giving me help? Another $250 after I couldn't board my flight and lost thousands of dollars. Why are you guys giving me a hard time? Isn't human service meant to handle this particular situation?
Why have human customer service when there is such a lack of empathy? Just live in the world of AI, oh no, probably AI is better than the human service they've trained.

Titles: Unmitigated garbage company DON'T DO IT
Details: Needed a room on short notice just for one night. Found Super.com and the rate was like $40 cheaper than direct with Hilton. Wonderful hotel in Pooler Georgia. Well I arrive at the hotel and ask me to pay for the room despite the fact that I had already paid Super.com. I was not in a huge hurry so I called super.com customer service and was told they would escalate the issue to the "Urgent Care Team" I asked when I might hear back from them, I mean the hotel lobby is nice but not trying to hang out there for hours. The agent told me they could not provide me an estimated time. So I say the heck with it I will just pay for the room again and hope that Super.com pays the hotel and some point and I can get a refund from the hotel. The young lady at the check in was amazing super helpful. So here I am 5 hours later, no call from the Urgent Care team, I am trying to chat with them and I have been waiting on an agent in the chat function for 20 mins at this point. Overall a HORRIBLE experience with these clowns. If you have last minute booking don't even think of using super.com. Seemed like a cool process and a way to save some money. Nope bad news. I read an article in Bloomberg that these clowns raised 85m in capital to grow super.com. I hope those investors have a better experience with this than its customers.

At that time I was told that my reservation was canceled and they could not give me a reason. I contacted Super who attempted to resolve but they advised me my reservation was canceled. I told them you took my money so get me rebooked. About 45 minutes later they called and said they couldn't but they would offer me a refund. That is a joke. That is all? Wow. A refund for something that was clearly not booked correctly. My take is that they gave me a rate that the hotel would never accept. Be wary of this site!

Com where I was apologized to but told they couldn't Refund $505 until everything was verified and my call was returned. 5 hours later I called back and got told my issue would be escalated and I will certainly get a call back. In the meantime all my money is tied up and a room somewhere else was tripled to $300 a night. I slept in the car after paying for a hotel! After 6 additional calls where they said they'd call me back and 3 days NO CALLS BACK! Now call 9 I'm told it won't get reviewed for 14 days and I may or may NOT get my $505 back and I would get a call in 14 Days! They STOLE $505 from me! No Customer service, No Hotel No Anything! SCAM, RIPOFF, BEWARE!

Titles: Every step of the way sucked! Don't be fooled by deals.
Details: I ended up on their site because it was the best deal I could get on a hotel for a weekend getaway. It was only $30 less and it was the biggest mistake booking through them. I thought I was getting a room on the top floor based on the fact I picked the room that stated balcony. When I spoke with the hotel they said that I actually had a bottom floor room and needed to contact super to change the room. When I did they said I couldn't and needed to cancel my booking and re-book. So I tried that and had them reimburse me through their points so I could use the money right away to re-book instead of waiting 3-5 days for reimbursement. This is where things started getting bad. I was told I could only use that money on their App, after downloading the App it sends a code to your phone before you can sign in. The code never sent. I contacted support and they told me to keep trying and/or redownload the App. I did this about 20 times before I gave up. Then I reached out to get a refund in full. They told me it would be 3-5 days and not to worry. I waited a little over a week and still no refund. So I reached out again and they said sorry it didn't process and now it would be 2-3 days. After 5 days I still didn't see my refund. So I processed a claim with PayPal. Well PayPal has also been no help at all and will not push the claim in my favor without an email from them about the refund. I asked them for this email and was told they don't do things that way. Then I asked again about the refund. First I was told that they have to reach out to the hotel which could take a while, and now I have been told they can say nothing to me because I made a claim so my account was shut off. It has been 36 days and still no refund...

Titles: True Total Review from Extensive Super.com User
Details:
For saving money, they are perhaps the best travel website and I've used dozens of various travel sites. I travel weekly. I've never had an overbook or stay issue. ** However, their customer service is not very good at all. You may wait a couple of hours to reach someone. When you do, you can tell they are in another country. But they don't seem to have any knowledge in resolving problems. They just give repeated statements with no research effort. One problem I had since they changed from Snaptravel to Supertravel is the earned $$ you accumulate from your stays. It's connected to your phone #. They now mandate you download their app in order to use those funds you've earned. The app never sends out 4-digit text message to confirm my phone number. Customer Service says it's my phone. The Geek squad at Best Buy went through my phone and other messages and says it is Super.com's app communication that is having the problem. The website can confirm the number and sends me texts all the time (same company). Almost seems like they are trying to keep me (customer) from using my earned $$. It worked fine on the mobile website. Customer Service manager says "no, you have to use a different phone number." I asked why? She said because your phone doesn't work. Sound fishy? The earned $$ is tied to the number that I've been using. If enough people make noise about it they will have to do something.

Again, discounted lodging = the best. Customer service and web support = the bottom.

We told the hotel about this and they said they couldn't return our money because we booked through a 3rd party OTA(online travel agency) and to call them. I called them and they gave me the run around. Now I'm out almost $600.3 stays 1) 8/19-8/22 paid $184.96 2) 8/22-8/25 paid $ 184.95,3) 8/25-8/28 paid $195.93. Not to mention the person whom helped me through chat was very rude and kayak should be ashamed of promoting them, been fighting for my money back for over a month. Charlotte Southpark via Super Travel (booking B_*******) and prepaid the full amount
Of $406.92. My mother had a stroke on 6/7/23 and I traveled from NC to MD to be with
Her. On 6/8/23 I contacted Super Travel and requested to cancel and be refunded. On
6/8/23 I also called the hotel directly and explained my situation and requested a
Refund. The hotel was very accommodating and said I could absolutely cancel my
Reservation. They also told me that SuperTravel was difficult to work with and if they
Denied my request for a refund to tell them verbatim: "I understand your following your
Policy but may I please speak to your supervisor. Please send me an email notification
Confirming a full refund and any penalty will be waived. If they say hotel won't cancel
"How can I get a credit so I can rebook thru you?" On 6/8/23 I received the following
Email from SuperTravel: "Hi Jessica, I am Mari from SuperTravel. I am reaching out
Because the hotel contacted us to let us know that they have approved a FOC
Cancellation for your booking on 09 Jun 2023. We just want to confirm that you would
Like to cancel this booking." I responded via email on 6/8/23 and confirmed the
Cancellation. I heard nothing further from SuperTravel nor did I receive a credit. On
BOTH 6/27/23 and 7/11/23, I emailed SuperTravel: "Please advise when I will be
Refunded $406.92. Thanks" On 7/23/23 I received the following email from
SuperTravel: "Hi Jessica, It's Maria here from Super Travel. I am following up on your
Ticket for booking B_*******. Unfortunately our travel partners denied confirmation
For the free of charge cancellation and so we will not be able to process a refund. We
Understand this may not be the outcome you expected and want to reassure we did
Our best. Thank you for understanding." I called, online chat, and emailed SuperTravel
Numerous times requesting a refund and they have refused.

Titles: DO NOT BOOK ON THIS SITE: SUPER.COM
Details:

I had a "Confirmed" Booking with Super.com on August 17 for the end of September. The web site states that reservations should be in Hotel Booking within a few days to weeks. As of Today, September 13, the Hotel STILL has no record. I have called, e-mailed, and requested to speak with a Supervisor or Manager repeatedly. None is ever able to get on the phone, and I was told I would receive a call back within 24-48 hours. I HAVE RECEIVED NO CALL BACKS. I have also received e-mails back from different individuals stating "I am working to resolve your issue" with no further communication despite my responding repeatedly to these e-mails, there is just NOBODY there to resolve. Super.com web site actually says that sometimes the booking at the hotel is not available until day of check in...HUH? Are we that stupid we would wait on a reservation until check in only to find out it is a SCAM? I have called the hotel repeatedly and they informed me that this particular company, Super.com is known for booking without forwarding the reservation to the Hotel. Remember, If the rate is too good to be true, DONT BELIEVE IT. DONOT USE SUPER.COM. Needless to say, I cancelled the reservation while still refundable according to booking, but am still waiting for it to be credited to my credit card account.

Titles: DO NOT BOOK WITH SUPER TRAVELS
Details: I booked a hotel with Super.com over Labor Day weekend. With a hurricane hitting Florida, my wife and I canceled our trip. All other hotels we booked that week canceled with no problems. For this hotel with Super.com, I used the link on my confirmation email to cancel within the allotted timeframe. There was not an option to cancel. I tried calling but was on hold for about an hour before giving up. I then spent hours of my Labor Day Weekend on hold with their "customer service" department, was disconnected multiple times (seemingly on purpose), and was finally told they need to check with their travel partners, which could take 30 days. When calling the hotel, they said they would cancel no problem, but because I booked with a third party (Super.com), they cannot do so and I must cancel through Super.com. So I know Super.com was not checking with any "travel partners." Instead, they were giving me the run around so they could just tell me canceling with a refund is not possible. Sure enough, a couple days later, they told me they could not issue a refund. This company shows absolutely no care for their customers. They way they treat their customers is downright disrespectful. I have never been treated by any company so poorly. Never ever book through super.com. I have learned my lesson the hard way and will be sure to never use their services ever again. Do not make the same mistake I did.

I reserved a town place suites room through super. My wife recently had some major GI surgery so we needed a kitchen, and we had dogs, so not the easiest problem to solve all at once.The entire process, beginning to end was enfuriating. For beginners, when you check their prices, there's a timer that starts, so if you don't reserve your room in time, the price goes up. So I had to use their link to send a code to my wife to give her 10% of the same room, which brought it to an amount higher than the original price displayed to me. But it was still cheaper than others, so i played their stupid game. I arrived at the room with my dogs who had been stuck in the car for 4 hours, along with a wife who was about to burst thanks to that GI surgery, and there was no reservation under my name. I called and learned that super.com doesn't reserve rooms with the hotel, the are a 4th party booker. They steal deals from other 3rd party bookers. So they never even talk to the hotel. They talk to other companies that talk to the hotel. So when I called to complain, they sent me to their "emergency guest services" which took 20 minutes to call me to tell me that they needed 20 minutes to call the other company then call me back. We're at 40 minutes with a bout to explode wife. Then they passed my complaint to the other company. They called back and told me the other company never recieved a confirmation from the hotel so they never actually booked it. Funny, my credit card was still charged. So they apologized and told me they could ask the other company to book me a new room. I asked if the room would have the same amenities. They said the only amenities they could guarantee was free breakfast and 2 queens. I asked about pets and kitchen and was told they couldn't guarantee those, and that it would take about an hour to find us a room. I just told them I'd take my money back and figure it out. I reserved a room without a kitchen because the hotel that I canceled with was no longer affordable at the current rate. An hour later I got a text from super saying they had an awesome deal at the exact room i originally booked at close to the original rate. Why they couldn't give me that information while I was sitting outside the hotel wishing I could be in it, I don't know. Wait, yes I do. They're a 4th party company. They are the sketchy friend, selling stuff from their friends cnsignment shop and trying to get a cut. I've already paid my pet fee, dealt with the BS, and now they're just throwing salt in the wound. Thanks. I'm done.

If you can avoid booking with them, it'd potentially save you a whole lot of frustration. I know I wish I never had.

The worst experience on a vacation I've had thus far reserving with these guys. I had 2 rooms reserved far in advance with super.com and reserving.com (with the purchased insurance mind you, both terrible agencies in refunding you your money). If you read the Diez Hotel website they claim both just a valid photo ID and easy cancellation if you run into any issues (see the screenshot for verification or the hotel's FAQs section).

Day 1 - We arrive at Medellin and it is raining. Immediately we try to check in to our already paid-for rooms with passport and/or government-issued IDs. However, the hotel denied our party the ability to check in because there is an "unwritten rule" that government IDs must be Colombian despite this not being a written policy anywhere nor a warning upon reservation. The hotel did not attempt to remediate the issue or be helpful whatsoever despite already being paid $800 for 2 rooms. Fortunately, other hotels nearby do not play these games and were more than welcoming to provide us rooms (tyvm Jo and Joe Hotel, they were half the price and super accommodating having no said policy to accept paying guests).

For the entirety of the vacation, I spent the week trying to get my $800 reimbursed by the hotel and reservation agencies because no service or rooms were provided. However, surprise surprise no one wants to return the money (even after purchasing the insurance with the reservation company!) and I am working ways to recoup my expenses having already paid half of that for 2 rooms with Jo and Joe Hotel, which again, were more than amazing and cheaper.

Stay away from Diez Hotel and this reservation company if you want to avoid a nightmare and not get robbed out of hundreds of dollars.

I booked a reservation for a hotel after my house caught fire and a second reservation was accidentally made. I contacted SuperTravel and a customer service rep told me my funds would be reissued in 2-3 business days. That did not occur. I called them back multiple times and finally got them to escalate the call to a manager, Mark Louie. He called me back and the phone rang 3 times and disconnected - I did not have time to catch the call before he hung up. He then responded via email (despite my request for a phone call) stating the reservation was non refundable and I needed a letter with signatures from the hotel owner and others stating they could refund me. I responded via email that they need to check my call where the customer service rep said I would be refunded. I emailed them 2-3 times with no response. I called back multiple times and Mark Louie called me back, only repeating it was non refundable and then the phone disconnected mid conversation. I tried calling back repeatedly but never heard from him again. I finally got the information of a new Supervisor, Annie, who was sympathetic to my situation and agreed they should honor what I was told originally and that she would negotiate a deal. I then received an Email from her stating I would not be refunded without that letter. My father passed away a month after the fire and I do not have time to jump through hoops, especially after I was told by the company I would receive my refund. A legitimate, reputable company would stay true to their word and not fight someone in their time of need. They are not a honorable and trustworthy business and I can only feel as though I've been scammed. And if you have to contact them after your reservation has been made, good luck getting through to them, especially if you need to speak to a manager. Beware doing business with SuperTravel

Titles: Do NOT use Super.com for any booking!
Details:
We booked a two-night hotel stay via Super.com, and paid directly to the website. We paid extra to have a room with two queen beds. When we arrived to the hotel, we found out that Super.com had sent them a reservation for the cheapest room they had, a room that only had one bed in it. In Super.com they had both room types listed. The one we booked and paid for was $110 per night, which we paid. The 1 bed room would have been cheaper. They listed it as $84 per night.
We called Super.com right away, expecting them to fix it so that we get the room we reserved and paid for. Little did we know. Their customer service calling center is probably in the Philippines - it was really hard to understand what they were saying. Instead of professionally checking the booking and getting us the room we had paid for, they totally gave us the runaround, asking us to email them paperwork from the hotel, they lied to us several times during the many calls and said someone will call us back - nobody ever called. They also lied and said they had sent us an email regarding the refund - but we received no emails either. There are no supervisors available at the calling center, and the reps on the phone don't have any idea what they are doing. They also have no authority to fix anything. All they do is they keep apologizing and apologizing and nothing gets fixed, and lying that someone is working on it and will call us and never do.
We kept trying to get the room we paid for for the two days we stayed in the hotel, but couldn't. We had no choice but to stay in the tiny room with just one bed - and with two adults, it was not comfortable. The hotel was really nice and they said Super.com has done this same to many customers, and every time they just give the guests the runaround and nothing happens.
They have promised to call us numerous times. Nobody has ever called. They said they had emailed us information, but that was a lie as well. No emails were received from them. Its now 3 days after we left that hotel, and I am STILL trying to get a refund for the difference between the room we booked and paid for, and the tiny room with one bed that Super.com reserved for us. The hotel says every time this happens, they send them the cheapest reservation and keep the difference between the higher room rate and the one they actually reserve.
Finally, yesterday we received a text from Super.com. The text said they are giving us a $30 credit we can use towards any reservation we make using Super.com! They owe me $86.67. That's the difference between the room we paid for, and the room they reserved us - and they offer a $30 credit that can only be used if we continue to use Super.com for our bookings! And a supervisor STILL hasn't called me, or emailed me. Not only they ruined our mini vacation by making our stay really uncomfortable, but they are stealing my money, the money I paid for the bigger, comfortable room we wanted. This is unbelievable. Do not let this happen to you. Use Hotels.com, Expedia, or any other service. It is not worth it to let them ruin your vacation. When something goes wrong, they do absolutely nothing to fix it, so don't bother.

Titles: NEVER USE SUPER.COM FOR BOOKING! IT'S A SCAM
Details: I am deeply dissatisfied and urge everyone to exercise caution when using SUPER.COM for hotel bookings. I recently booked a room in Orlando at the Wyndham Lake Buena Vista Disney Springs Resort Area through this site. At first glance, the price appeared to be a bargain. However, upon arrival at the hotel, I was blindsided by an additional $123 resort fee. To make matters worse, the condition of the place was far from what was expected; it was in a deplorable state internally. Shockingly, this hefty fee was sneakily tucked away in fine print on SUPER.COM's website, with no transparent mention during the booking process. To verify this, I compared their process with Expedia's, which explicitly informed customers of any additional resort fees, even collecting them upfront. I booked business class seats for my 90 year old mother and sister on Lufthansa in February 2023 for travel June 30th to Europe through SnapTravel.com now known as Super.com. I received a confirmation number and eticket numbers. I was able to select seats for them right away and even order a wheelchair for my mother a week before their flight. They went to the airport on the day of travel, and the Lufthansa ticket agent told them that their tickets had been refunded, but they had received no notification from SnapTravel and no refund. They had to buy the last two economy tickets on the only available light to Europe that at a cost of 6,600 USD for both.
Snaptravel send out an email to my mother THE DAY AFTER their scheduled travel. I included the email below. DO NOT BOOK WITH THESE PEOPLE! DO NOT TRUST THEM! THEY COULD DO TO YOU WHAT THEY DID TO MY FAMILY!

***Email received a day too late….on July 1st
Hello,

We are reaching out to you from Super's (formerly SnapTravel) Corporate team regarding your upcoming flight reservation made through a third party, Bookingvault. In the event that your flight has already been completed, you can disregard this message.

We have recently learned that, for reasons beyond Super's control, the party with whom you booked your flight(s), Bookingvault, has ceased operations. Please note that your reservation is still valid and you can continue to travel as scheduled. However, because your booking was with Bookingvault and not Super, Super has limited access to service your reservation. For support, you can contact the airline of travel through their customer service lines. For cancellation or change requests, you can contact the airline or we suggest reaching out to your bank to request for assistance for a card refund/reimbursement, due to Bookingvault's inaccessibility.
We reiterate our apologies for any inconvenience and we appreciate your patience and understanding.

Regards,
Corporat

Titles: Worst 3rd Party Ever for Travel Booking
Details: My husband and I booked a last minute room at a hotel that ended up being filthy and disgusting when we arrived to stay there. We ended up finding a better hotel to stay at and the filthy hotel agreed to give us a refund, but stated we would have to get in touch with Super Travel to release the refund since we booked through them. We called Super, and they said they could release our refund as long as the hotel sent them an email stating they approved the refund. The hotel agreed to this and sent Super an email stating they approved a refund for us. We heard nothing from Super for weeks. We called them to check the status of this, and they claimed they sent us an email that they denied our refund, even though the hotel approved a refund. They would not give us a legitimate reason, they said their "travel partners" reviewed our case and denied a refund. The representatives we talked to were incredibly unhelpful and just kept repeating that "their travel partners denied our refund" and wouldn't even tell us who these "travel partners" are. This company is incredibly sketchy and does horrible business. I would give 0 stars if I could. Avoid using them at all costs.

If you don't want to read it all, just know this company is extremely unethical, unprofessional and I would avoid them. Here's the story. Showed up to the hotel at 1:30am after a long day of travel, and the front desk stated they could not locate my booking. Called SuperTravel customer service. Left on hold for quite some time and then finally patched through to a representative. Said they will escalate to "Urgent Care team" and that they will call back in 20mins. Fast forward an hour and 30mins, it's now around 3:30am and finally get a response. The company states they could not get a hold of the front desk. This is a blatant lie as I was next to the front desk the entire time and not once did they call. They are not able to resolve the issue and offer to cancel my stay. I'm forced to rebook at a different hotel as the one I originally booked is sold out (at a much higher price). I emailed my original hotels customer service to investigate and it turns out SuperTravel had cancel the reservation 40mins after I had booked. Completely fraudulent. Please, please avoid this company. Extremely unethical. And if they had canceled my reservation after 40mins of me booking, the least the company could have done is informed me. Yet instead I waste 2 hours at 3am and already tired from travel. Avoid this company like the plague. I will warn everyone I know about them.

Titles: TERRIBLE - NO RESERVATION FOUND AND NO REFUND
Details:
My wife and I booked a 5 star hotel in Portugal via this website as it showed an attractive price. Upon arriving at the hotel, there was NO reservation found in the hotel system. Being in a different country and in a different timezone we could not reach anyone except chat. The chat reps did not help at all and we were forced to rebook at the hotel at a higher price.

We did hear back from Super via email and they informed us that they made a mistake and reserved us at a totally different hotel miles away!? They reassured us that we would get a full refund once an invoice is shared with them upon checking out.

Upon check out I sent out a copy of the invoice and it has been weeks since I've heard from SUper and of course NO REFUND for a $600+ hotel.

Obviously, I DO NOT RECOMMEND anyone using this site and just stick to the big players. My next steps are to dispute the charges with my CC and to share my horrible experience.
Had I not used Trivago/Super.com I would've paid a higher price!

Titles: I strongly advise against engaging with this company
Details:
I strongly advise against engaging with this company due to their poor refund process and unhelpful customer service. Despite the initial impression of cost savings, I regret choosing them for my stay at the Hilton on April 20,2023. I canceled the trip on July 10th, which was the last eligible day for a refund. According to their communication, the refund was processed and should have been returned to the original payment card within 1-5 business days.

However, five business days passed, and I did not receive the refund. Since then, I have made numerous phone calls and sent multiple emails, encountering unresponsive and repetitive responses from their agents. They simply state that the refund has been processed and advise me to contact my bank. I explained that my bank confirmed having no record of the refund, and I even offered to share my credit card statement as proof.

Their agents lack transparency and seem defensive, with one of them attempting to misinform me about the processing time, contrary to their own stated terms and conditions. As of today, I have still not received the refund, which amounts to nearly $1000.00. This experience has left a negative impression, and I will not consider using their services in the future.

Last minute desicion to make a booking, super.com were the cheapest by far. The hotel direct which I'm a member at, was over £20 more expensive. Booking was simple process. Would def use this site again.
I was dropping off one of my security guards and needed a place for him. The rates I got were much better than the ones I know for such hotels.

SuperTravel makes it impossible to process a refund for a stay, no matter the reason. They claim you can refund a booking up to a few days in advance but the reality is once they have charged your card, which is immediate, you are on you own. Only way to reach out is email or live chat. Chat is useless. They don't respond to emails. Their specials are usually for hotels that are 1 or 2 stars. Don't use this site and don't trust their deals.

They even blamed it on our financial institution ATB! This company comes across as corrupt. If we ever get our refund that will be a surprise. This should not be this difficult! Titles: Be Wary!hen I asked him to verify that they would not be pulling anymore money from my account
Details:
I signed up for the"Super Plus" membership, they charged me the $15 membership fee. Almost right after signing up and paying the fee, I cancelled my membership because I changed my mind. The processed the fee an I called them the 2nd following business day to confirm cancellation and request a refund. After being ranferred twice their system ended the call, so I had to call back. When I finally reached a representative, he informed me that their fees are nonrefundable. When I asked if he could confirm that my account had been cancelled, he asked me personally identifying questions ( questions that an identity thief might ask - or a thief in general) then informed me thay he did not have access to view my account. I then questioned him to be sure they would not be pulling money from my account going forward and he said they would...? Sounds very SKETCHY to me! Now I have to freeze my bank account and cancel my debit card as well as mess up other financial transactions tied to them. I would have to say that my opinion of this company is:
RUNNNNNNNNN! RUN FAR AWAY FROM THEM! SaSAVE YOURSELF (& PROBABLY YOUR IDENTITY)!

Titles: Refusal to take responsibility of false advertising
Details: I stayed at Springhill Suites by Mariott in Chicago which Super Travel advertised having a pool. This was the main reason we chose this hotel. When it didn't have a pool, I contacted Super who claimed it wasn't their problem and to contact the hotel. I went down and spoke to the hotel front desk who said since I booked directly with Super, it was their responsibility to make it right. Super stated they wanted a letter stating to give me a refund, which the hotel refuses to do since I didn't book with them. The price was the best price of any other place for this hotel, but please make sure you review the hotel on their own page before booking with Super because they do advertise incorrect information.

Titles: Stealing from the working class USA
Details:
www.super.com

We had a reservation done on a 3rd party travel site. The reservation was canceled by Motel 6 because my friend and his wife were put on a 60-day Do Not Rent list. I wasn't aware of it, and they said that they weren't either. The reservation was accepted by Super.com but was canceled by Motel 6. We were supposed to check in on July 1st, 2023, and then check out on July 6th, 2023. Super.com escalations told me that we aren't going to get our money back because they are a 3rd party booking company and that refunds are 100% nonrefundable. How are these ethical business practices? That's basically legalizing stealing from hard-working people. Plus, after looking at their terms and conditions they say we agree to waive our rights to a specific arbitrator court system. We couldn't use the reservation and I work payday to payday to try to support myself and survive. The total cost of the reservation is $650 dollars. I had sent 400 to help pay for the room, for me that's a lot of money and to some people that's a little. I am living Bi-weekly paycheck to paycheck. But I live in Colorado and the cost of living in this state is outrageous. Don't forget about the working class who are trying to survive.

I booked a room for a one night stay at a hotel 250 miles out the evening before I left for my trip. The day of my arrival prior to check in, the hotel did not have my reservation. I contacted customer service and they fixed the issue, got my room, no big deal. Now this is where the issue comes in. The hotel I was staying at charged me an additional $200 because they said SuperTravel did not pay them! I told the hotel I have a receipt of my payment through SuperTravel but it didn't matter since the company didn't pay them. When I started chatting with SuperTravel customer service, I gave my confirmation number and email, the representative said the email was wrong. I literally had to send them a screenshot to prove it was correct. After that, they told me to email customer support to get my refund. I haven't heard from ANYONE through email. I then just disputed the charge with my bank and hoping to get my money back that way. If I had known it would be this ridiculous I would've stayed away from them to begin with.

I booked a reservation through Super Travel to stay at the Red Roof Inn at Aberdeen Maryland Saturday June 24-25 for one night. My son and I was accompanied by a cousin who lives about five minutes drive away from the Red Rood In where we were supposed to stay. At the Red Roof the attendant Kisn asked how many people are going to stay there in the room. I replied, "why are you asking me that question when my cousin is here just to show us the easiest way from his home." Next, Kisn told me that the Red Roof Inn is not a government property it is a private property. I replied, "what type of BS service that Red Roof is giving us, and that he the employee of the Red Roof should offer professional service."
Immediately, the attendant (Kisn) cancelled my reservation, then remit my card for the $100 dollar he had charge my card then told us to find another hotel to stay in.
Looking at my bank account I notice that Super Travel had charge my debit card for the sum of $89.95 for a service that I did not receive. I want Super Travel to remit my money. Next, I will take it up with Red Roof about the lack of professional service from their attendant.

Then I get an email saying they won't refund because it was a no refund booking. I have all the documention on calls as this was NOT my mistake!
The experience was seamless and nothing was too much trouble. We would be comfortable to use them again

I used Super.com to book and I must say it was an excellent experience. It was very easy to use and saved me a lot of money. Got a great price and also received an invitation to book again for a couch up to thirty dollars off on my next stay. Definitely will use site again. Frank O.,

Details: No customer service. The worst my mom died, and I'm just trying to get some money back because we had major storm damage. They won't let me upload pics horrible don't ever book with these people. So I canceled early and they won't refund me

I have been waiting at my hotel for 9 hours to check in, as it is stating that the payment method through SuperTravel is declined at the hotel. Yet, SuperTravel took the money out of my account yesterday when the reservation was made. Contacted SuperTravel & stated I would hear back in 20 minutes with an answer. It has been NINE hours. Horrible customer service. I am still waiting at the hotel, & no one will answer me at SuperTravel. 0 star review if I could.
Charged me 251 and a friend booked a larger room within a 15 minute timeline at 144.00! No rebate offered

HAD TO REPORT TO MY BANK AS FRAUDULENT! THE COMPANY WILL CHARGE AND NOTHING IS LEGITIMATE! THE CUSTOMER SERVICE LIES ABOUT THEIR NAMES -REFUSE REFUNDS AFTER CHARGING CARDS AND DOESN'T CALLBACK.THEY PIGGYBACK ON EXPEDIA BOOKINGS AND EXPEDIA DOESN'T HAVE ACCESS TO ANYTHING THEY BOOK FOR YOU AND NEITHER DOES THE HOTEL YOU'RE RESERVED AT… SAVE THE HEADACHE AND DO NOT BOOK WITH SUPER TRAVEL OR SUPER.COM

All i wanted for the inconvenience was a credit/ different booking date.
All the stipulations when the airlines mess up with no accomodations is crazy. I can go on about all the parties involved but I won't. What these people do is disgusting. CROOKS!

Titles: If I could do 0/5 I would
Details: They messed up the dates for our reservation. There was no confirmation page nor communication that reservations couldn't be changed or refunded until I got the email where it had the wrong dates. Tried their chat function to fix it but it was very clearly ai robot and copy pasted everything. It took multiple attempts before they finally escalated me to a supervisor who said they would refund me if I got the hotel to email them a confirmation that they've canceled the reservation. I called the hotel and they were happy to help but by their policy they do not send out confirmation emails to third parties due to it being forgable and said that they only needed to call them and they would confirm the cancelation. Called back and told them this and they refused trying to say they could not make phone calls only recieve them. When I pointed out their supervisor called me I was put on hold for about the 4th time. They argued with me about the hotel's policy even though I explained to them what the manager told me. They still refused and lied straight to my face about not being able to make calls out. They tried blaming me for everything. Even though I had screenshoted proof otherwise. They are horrible in every possible way. They fringe sympathy and then stick you on hold whenever they don't want to deal with you. Not worth it. Spend the bit extra to go through a better site like the hotels actual site or experian. They are scammers through and through

EASY TO RESERVE AND GOOD DEALS, I will use it a next time...
THANK YOU

I wanted to book a room for that same night but The website had pre-selected Sunday night and i did not realize before I payed for the room. I only realized it after it was paid for. When I contacted customer service via chat, I told them I DIDNT want to cancel the reservation, I only wanted to change the date of the reservation and they refused. They stated they do not give refunds and will not change the date of the reservation. Which is total BULLS**T.
DO NOT GO THROUGH SUPERTRAVEL.com! Your best bet is to go with a travel site more focused on customer experience/support and more reputable like TRAVELOCITY, EXPEDIA, KAYAK…ANYONE other than supertravel. I feel sure they would have changed the date for me.

Titles: Super travel charged me and didn't pay the hotel, worst site, be aware of it
Details: I was charged by super travel when I made the booking however when I checked out of the hotel they informed me that super travel have not paid for my stay and charged me again. It's been month now I am chasing super travel for the refund and on top of it worst customer care, they will always says we are working on it and never follow up and inform about anything. Please never book anything through super travel, they are fake, I now have to look for legal help in this.

Super Travel will not refund a money that was granted by the hotel I stayed. Super travel agent don't speak good English, they keep repeating information, dropping calls, and refusing to provide access to management. I provided all documentation they asked for and they pretended that they never received it or that it was not the correct information. Lastly, they block my number and emails responses do not allow for a case to be resolved. They closed the case immediately even when I provided ALL the information they requested. Emails are all generated without addressing concerns.

CAUTIOUS: THEY STEAL YOUR MONEY.

Attached are proof of my statement and response. I also proceed to report them to BBB.

STAY AWAY!

Booked through this site and was unhappy with the rooms at the hotel. The hotel would not provide itemized receipts because I booked through this site. The hotel referred me back to Super to get receipts. I contacted Super who gave me basic receipts which showed nothing of value other then the cost at booking. I asked for itemized receipts to which they said they couldn't provide. I mean what kind of legitimate business can't or won't provide detailed receipts? All they would provide was the original booking receipt. I expressed frustration in a very, very professional and courteous way. They then stopped all communication and I'm stuck not being able to get help from the hotel OR Super. I will not use this site again and will discourage others from doing so. By the looks of things, I'm not the only unhappy FORMER customer or theirs. DO NOT USE THIS SITE because if you have any issues with the booking, you will not get assistance.

This place is ridiculous. Tried to add my brother to the reservation I booked so that he'd be able to check in without me. They tell me is a $15 charge to do so... he's already going to be there why is there a charge to add him so he can check in?! They try to make money any freakin way they can, ridiculous!

I booked a hotel for a one night stay when I was in a town, they changed the date to a week later, and refused to refund me or accommodate to the date I was actually in town, even though the hotel staff told them they had plenty of open rooms. On top of that, they charged me a $30 accommodation fee for something they never even changed. Their goal is to take your money and get out of dodge. Completely awful company.

Awful company. Our hotel unforfunately lost water. We were unable to shower, brush our teeth, use the toilet, wash our hands etc. The hotel was issuing refunds to all guests. We were advised to contact Super for a refund/discount, as we paid them directly. Super refused to help and claimed they are just a booking service and will not issue discounts for hotel malfunction, whether there is a sanitary emergency or not. We talked to the hotel manager, who was equally frustrated with them. She said multiple 3rd party booking companies had called her to verify and proceeded to issue refunds to their customers. Super still refused to provide assistance. The hotel was kind enough to step in and provide the customer service that Super refused. We signed up for wyndom rewards and they issued us enough points for 2 free hotel stays in the future. Super is AWFUL

I would give 0 stars if I could. I booked a reservation and their website sent a reservation for a standard one bed room when their site clearly showed a price for two beds. I have photos of what it showed. I got someone in the Philippines named Leona, she said I will need to charge you a cancelation fee. I said why would you charge me anything, you should just fix my reservation to what I booked. She said I am on the site and there is no issues and we have had no other complaints, like I am lying. I wish you could see the website pictures and you would know I am telling the truth. I asked for a supervisor and she said they were just going to tell me the exact same thing as she was telling me and they would not fix it, because I booked the wrong room. I got a call back from an agent who lied and said he was a supervisor. I was trying to tell him what happened and he cut me off and said I was talking too much. I asked for his name and refused to give it to me and hung the phone up in my ear. They have all this staff in the Philippine's working from home and the service is horrible. I booked the room their site showed me as two beds. I booked this for 3 men, and it says 3. Why would I ever book one queen bed for 3 grown big men? Do not ever use these people. They are dishonest and will not fix their issues and work to make things right. The site said total for 2 beds was 110.00 per night and with taxes and fees a total of $134.91. Beware they will not help you and they threaten you. I have noticed more and more that customer service employees in the Philippines are getting smart with US citizens and are not trying to help them resolve issues. Customer Service is horrible and only threatened me with fees and blamed me for messing up, when its their system that messed up. Stay clear of Super Travel. They are very very unethical and will not help you. Please see my photos showing what was presented on the site when I booked the reservation. Their site was wrong and listed two beds for the standard room and they would not fix the issue.

I deleted my original review as I told them I would because I am a person of integrity and do what I say I will.
Booked for the wrong weekend by mistake. After much back and forth they offered me almost a 50% refund. Not what I wanted but better then nothing.
I did pay the $29 cancellation fee but apparently they determined if the reason is valid for a refund. Originally denied all of the money.
Please please proceed with caution. Read and understand all the information before you book with them.

Made and paid for reservation on line. When I went to the hotel they had no reservation AND they were sold out. Went back to website- still showed availability- called customer service. Waited on wie for 20 minutes to speak to someone. Worthless. Said they'd escalate my problem and I'd get a call back in 15-20 mins.
Never got a call back. Can get
It resolved. Currently disputing charge on my credit card.
Do not use these people!
Kayak - shame on you for promoting them.

Titles: I would rate it 0 if I could
Details: I have used Super Travel countless times in the past and this was the FIRST time I have had a negative experience. I had a reservation in a tiny town that my stay is very dependent on others' actions. I tried to cancel and was informed that there are NO REFUNDS OR MODIFICATIONS. Knowing the nature of my visits, I would never book a room that was non-refundable but the lack of customer service or empathy is beyond me. I will NEVER use.this.service again and would strongly advise others to heed the same warning.

Titles: Worst Customer service ever! Use Booking.com
Details: Call customer service never called back, emails never get answers and "chat" leads to the same answer and says they will email... Spend a few bucks and use Booking.com

They took my money for a room and the hotel could never find the booking. Then customer service gave me the run around and kept saying urgent care would contact me a whole two days later. Confirmation number is *******.

Really nice for a first experience with Super.com, thank you very much

Did not know tour site exits, great and helpful surprise for me

Well, I had my first encounter with this site and I would like to tell everybody that this is nothing but just a scam I said purchase the extra $20 refundable cancellation policy yet still they denied my request even though it is within their guidelines. They also like to use fear, mongering and scare tactics to keep people from going to their banks, and disputing their transactions, because they are nothing but any legitimate institution that has been doing nothing other than stealing money from hard-working people also known as American citizens, I will be seeing them in court and I will also be canceling my transactions with my bank because this is ridiculous and I will like to tell anybody never to use this site ever again since I can see already that nobody else has also ever wrote a good review about them.

I booked a room for 5 nights! I had to cancel my room due to it being dirty and weed inside my room. I looked at two rooms while I was at the hotel both horrible and smelled like weed. I have a two year old so of course I'm not going to put him in that situation.I spoke with a supervisor named Charles he told me if I cancel my reservation and get a written letter stating my room was canceled I would be able to book another room through them. Well the hotel I stayed at refused to write a letter for me they said super travel would have to call them.This was at 5:00 pm. As I'm writing this I am still trying to get in touch with them I have chatted with customer service online and they weren't helpful at all I have been on hold with them for 4 hours now still at number 3. So now I have nowhere to go and I'm in the car at 11:02 pm with a 2 year old.All because of super travel. They are horrible I would never book with them again they did not try to accommodate me in any way I spent over 400 on booking my hotel for 5 days this company is trash! Don't book with them they only care about taking your money! I am beyond pissed.This is the way they treat tree customers this company is a fraud and a scam.
My partner and I used Super.com to book a hotel in Toronto. Super.com had the best rate that we found online. We had a seamless check-in at the hotel. Would recommend!

I wanted to book Amour Alaçatı Boutique Hotel in Alaçatı Turkey through Trivago website on 10 June 2023. Trivago directed me to this site as the cheapest offer. Believing in the reliability of Trivago site, I booked one night through this site and paid for it. After paying, I doubted on the site's reality and later I called the hotel and they informed me that reservation was not made. After the payment screen, only a fake voucher appeared on the screen as I really made a reservation. No mail no nothing came to me. I've been scammed. Super.com defrauded me, took my money, did not make the reservation. I wish I wasn't directed to this site.

Super Travel. Do not book any 3rd party for hotels especially this company. The have their no refund/cancellation policy to screw over people. Booked for this weekend but they changed the dates to the following weekend and wouldn't do anything about it. Emailed them the issue was on THEIR end and Kelly referring me to their cancellation policy and closing the ticket on my issue. Worst thing I have ever seen from a company. DO NOT USE

Titles: I wish I could give them a 0
Details: This company is a scam, don't book anything with them. I was looking at the prices of hotel rooms and without any approval, my Apple Pay information was applied and the hotel was booked. I immediately called to explain what had happened and they told me "that's too bad, but there id nothing we can do". All I really wanted was a different hotel because the one booked genuinely did not work for me. They were not willing to do anything. Don't even open their website or you will risk this happening.

I wanted to share with you my experience ordering with super. Com. We are 2 couples and we booked through booking. Com 2 double rooms with cancellation option. A week before arrival, I did another price check on Google and found out that super. Com offer the same deal for 150 euros less. A significant difference, the truth is I hurried and ordered on the spot and immediately canceled in booking. Com. Only then did I start reading reviews and was pretty scared. All the reviews are bad and I felt like I fell into a trap. But in practice nothing bad happened. We arrived at the hotel and the room was waiting for us and they stood beyond what was agreed upon. Indeed a sigh of relief. Bottom line, they keept there word. It is also worth noting that we paid with PayPal. Better in my opinion. So thanks to super. Com for saving us money and good luck to everyone.

Titles: I am literally considering starting a class action suit against this company
Details: I searched for a specific date, they listed the rates, chose a rate (happened to have a big warning that there was only one left!), they listed the rooms, I selected a room. The confirmation comes, all booked. Next thing I know the confirmation comes in an it is for the day I'm booking. Not sure exactly how the dates changed but if they refresh dates so you have to select again even though the entire booking process was for other dates is deceitful. To top it of, no refund OR modification. Too many reviews about the same experience. I'm not going to let this go.

At a short notice I needed a room to meet a friend. Pleasantly surprised that the room met all my needs! I needed a place to bring my bicycle indoors and the management was more than accommodating! They helped me store it in a spare room!
Thanks,
-Brian

I booked through them with out doing proper research (my fault). I looked into them after the fact i paid, saw the reviews and panicked. I had gotten a decent hotel in downtown chicago for the night. (The congress). I booked it 3 days before my check in day. I called the hotel the night after and confirmed my booking and reservation. I still reached out to customer service for peace of mind, they said my reservation was all set. That they were sorry i was unsure of them. Etc. I went to the hotel and everything went through and pre paid. The only charge i needed to pay was the refundable safety deposit of $25. I didnt have to repay for the room or anything and it all went smoothly. I dont know why it went so well, i dont know what i did differently than others. But im not sure id book through them again just to save myself stress and worry of being scammed. But thankful it worked out well and i didnt get scammed.
